text: Merlin Charles Sainthill Hanbury-Tracy, 7th Baron Sudeley (17 June 1939 – 5 September 2022)Lord Sudeley, peer who courted controversy with his fondness for reactionary causes – obituary was a British peer, author, and monarchist. In 1941, at the age of two, he became the Barony of Sudeley. He was a member of the Conservative Party. He was Vice-Chancellor of the International Monarchist League, and President of the Traditional Britain Group. ==References== Category:1939 births Category:2022 deaths Category:Conservative Party members of the Scottish Parliament Category:Politicians from London Category:Businesspeople from London Category:Writers from London Category:United Kingdom Barons
title: Merlin Hanbury-Tracy, 7th Baron Sudeley
